text: The Azamgarh alcohol poisonings resulted in the deaths of 39 people in Azamgarh city of Uttar Pradesh state in India, In October 2013, due to consumption of moonshine mixed with the methyl alcohol (methanol). This is one of the worst alcohol poisonings in the state. Locals contested the death toll claiming 40 people had died in the incident. ==See also== *List of alcohol poisonings in India == References == Category:Alcohol-related deaths in India Category:Crime in Uttar Pradesh Category:2013 disasters in India Category:Azamgarh
title: Azamgarh alcohol poisonings
